result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment. Per WICS, no payments were made to substantiate the adjustment.
Signed by Judge Carter on 08/11/15.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher A Williams in court with attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Court Sentences defendant to the following.

COUNT#1: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER
 
TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession illegal drugs or no drug paraphernalia; 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed; 
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  15 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions -STAYED- (to be used at agent's discretion)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court with Attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for jury status.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Martinez requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on March 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court with Attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests an adjournment as he is still waiting to hear from charging district attorney regarding counter offer.  Court puts case on jury status and jury trial calendar.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on January 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court with Attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests a 30 day adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on December 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court with attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court with attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court without counsel.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like the court to appoint counsel as he is not eligible for the public defender. Court grants the request and the defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 09/30/2014 and the last day of every month thereafter.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is not eligible for the public defender.  Defendant is requesting time to speak with private counsel.  Court tolled the time limits and adjourns the matter for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Christopher A Williams in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
